### Why? 

------------------------------------------------------------------------

-   Store observations at the touch of a button (i.e. from phone to Breedbase)

-   Those observations are more organized than on a drive

-   May contain timestamps/ other metadata

-   (Underrated but) plays nicely with Windows

```{r}
library(QBMS)

```

------------------------------------------------------------------------

### What is it good for?

------------------------------------------------------------------------

-   Clearly defined traits

-   Clearly defined trials

-   ALTs

------------------------------------------------------------------------

### What isn't it good for?

-   On-the-fly observations/ traits

-   Repeated measurements

------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Other (minor) hassles

-   Configuring devices

-   Passing data in can be finicky (for example, planning a trial)

-   IMO these things can be dealt with but take some patience

------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Finally

This is my (limited) view of Breedbase's capabilities. It can do many more things.
